From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To specify the IP address of an interface as the source address for Telnet connections, use the **ip telnet source-interface** command in global configuration mode. To reset the source address to the default for each connection, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: The interface whose address is to be used as the source for Telnet connections.

Examples: The following example forces the IP address for Ethernet <interface> 1 as the source address for Telnet connections:
ExtraInfo: Use this command to set the IP address of an interface as the source for all Telnet connections.If the specified interface is not up, the Cisco IOS software selects the address of the interface closest to the destination as the source address.

RelatedCmds.description: Forces RADIUS to use the IP address of a specified interface for all outgoing RADIUS packets.
